intro: Oxydectes stylosa, commonly known as the slender-flowered oxeye, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are small, yellow, and clustered in a head, with pale green bracts. Oxydectes stylosa is often found in fynbos vegetation, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
